channel.title: Comments on: Fixing orphaned database users in 2005 to 2012 – T-SQL Tuesday #025
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Sujeet
item.dc:creator: Sujeet
item.description: Could you please show how you correctly found the orphaned "windows" users at first place? sp_change_users_login shows the report for SQL users only. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: Could you please show how you correctly found the orphaned “windows” users at first place? sp_change_users_login shows the report for SQL users only. Thanks.

item.title: By: SQL Server drop and create all users in every DB | XL-UAT
item.dc:creator: SQL Server drop and create all users in every DB | XL-UAT
item.description: […] In any event, the real problem tends to be that dropping a user is a potentially disruptive and destructive act. It may work, but it may also cause some bad side-effects. Nonetheless, if you want to try that, then the best procs I know of for that are from Ted Krueger and they are located here: /index.php/DataMgmt/DBAdmin/fixing-orphaned-database-users. […]
item.content:encoded: […] In any event, the real problem tends to be that dropping a user is a potentially disruptive and destructive act. It may work, but it may also cause some bad side-effects. Nonetheless, if you want to try that, then the best procs I know of for that are from Ted Krueger and they are located here: /index.php/DataMgmt/DBAdmin/fixing-orphaned-database-users. […]

item.title: By: Is there a shorthand way to 'Auto_Fix' all Orphaned Users in an SQL Server 2008 R2 database? | XL-UAT
item.dc:creator: Is there a shorthand way to 'Auto_Fix' all Orphaned Users in an SQL Server 2008 R2 database? | XL-UAT

item.title: By: Qais
item.dc:creator: Qais
item.description: You can also just use some complex password such as P@ssword_123
item.content:encoded: You can also just use some complex password such as P@ssword_123

item.title: By: Dave
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.content:encoded:
If you get a “Password validation failed. The password does not meet Windows policy requirements because it is not complex enough”, add

, CHECK_POLICY = OFF

inside the quotes on line 34.

Thanks Ted!
